result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurt Alva Hickman Jr

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion to Revoke DEOJ of Count One
Review hearing on April 28, 2023 at 10:45 am.

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 11:20 am.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears with Attorney Dave Casey. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

PLEA to Ct.1(DC/Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis.

COURT withholds finding and entry of guilt - Court adopts written Deferred Entry of Judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to the Court.
COURT defers matter for a period of 9 months for Defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEOJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct.1;

DEOJ RH set for 4/28/23 at 10:45 am.
Bond continues. 

Adj: 11:24 am.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on July 28, 2022 at 11:20 am.
Jury status hearing on August 30, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Jury Trial on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

CONTINUED.    No contact with victim(s):  RKS.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort (MNSO) to retreive any personal property.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.    Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:24 pm 
State appears by ADA Davis Runde; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Reading Waived.  
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel - Deft notes he has an attorney. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $150 cash bond continue - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): RKS. 
- Police (MNSO) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol

BRANCH 3 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 6/1/2022 at 3pm. 
FPT: 7/28/2022 at 11:20 am. 
Jury Status Review: 8/30/2022 at 2:45 pm. 
Jury Trial:  9/8/2022 at 9:00 a.
